newsitem.title: CHAD: IMF backs Chad adjustment programme.
newsitem.headline: IMF backs Chad adjustment programme.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has endorsed Chad's progress in reforming its economy and will release 12 billion CFA francs of funding envisaged as part of the programme, a government statement said on Saturday.
The statement, signed by Finance Minister Bichara Cherif Daoussa, said that half the money would be made available to the impoverished, sprawling African nation from October 31.
The money to be released is the second tranche of an Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility, agreed as part of a deal signed in September 1995.
President Idriss Deby, who seized power in a French-backed coup in 1990, won a multi-party presidential election in July. Legislative elections are due on December 22 and February 2.
